---
slug: /165
title: "This Week In React #165: StyleX, CSS Hooks, PandaCSS, Tailwind, Redux, Astro, Next.js, Remix, Storybook, React-Native 0.73, State of React-Native, Skia text layouts, Expo EAS..."
authors: [slorber]
date: 12-06-2023
---
I've found this week's CSS news particularly interesting! StyleX, CSS Hooks, Panda, Tailwind, CSS4...

translations.fr: J'ai trouv√© les actualit√©s CSS de cette semaine particuli√®rement int√©ressantes ! StyleX, CSS Hooks, Panda, Tailwind, CSS4...

segments.source_content: RevenueCat gives you everything you need to monetize, analyze, and grow your app business. Effortlessly control customer access and entitlements, manage data, and experiment with pricing. See why over 30,000 apps trust RevenueCat to power their in-app purchase infrastructure.

segments.source_content: Meta's CSS-in-JS solution is finally open-sourced, after a long wait. It is used on major apps such as Facebook, Instagram and WhatsApp. It is not strictly coupled with React. Atomic CSS will be extracted at build time, and there is a lightweight runtime for concatenating classes. TypeScript support is well-thought-out. The API is minimalist, relying mainly on 2 functions: `create` and `props`. We'll see how this new solution will position itself in an ecosystem that is already fairly competitive with Tailwind, Panda and a few others.

translations.fr: La solution CSS-in-JS de Meta est enfin open-source apr√®s une longue attente. Elle est utilis√©e sur des applications majeures comme Facebook, Instagram et WhatsApp. Elle n'est pas strictement coupl√©e √† React. Le CSS atomique est extrait au moment du build, avec un runtime l√©ger pour concat√©ner les classes. Le support TypeScript est bien pens√©. L'API est minimaliste, reposant principalement sur 2 fonctions : `create` et `props`. Reste √† voir comment cette nouvelle solution se positionnera dans un √©cosyst√®me d√©j√† concurrentiel avec Tailwind, Panda et quelques autres.
translations.en: La solution CSS-in-JS de Meta est enfin open-source apr√®s une longue attente. Utilis√©e sur des applications majeures comme Facebook, Instagram et WhatsApp, elle n'est pas strictement coupl√©e √† React. Le CSS atomique est extrait au build, avec un runtime l√©ger pour la concat√©nation des classes. Le support TypeScript est bien con√ßu. L'API minimaliste repose principalement sur 2 fonctions : `create` et `props`. Nous verrons comment cette nouvelle solution se positionne dans un √©cosyst√®me d√©j√† concurrentiel avec Tailwind, Panda et d'autres.

segments.source_content: CSS library with React bindings, offering a real return to basics via inline styles. In [From CSS madness to CSS Hooks](https://nsaunders.dev/posts/css-madness-to-hooks), the author explains how he uses a variable CSS trick to support missing features such as media-queries, pseudo-selectors and so on.

translations.fr: Biblioth√®que CSS avec bindings React, proposant un retour aux fondamentaux via les styles inline. Dans [From CSS madness to CSS Hooks](https://nsaunders.dev/posts/css-madness-to-hooks), l'auteur explique comment il utilise une astuce CSS variable pour supporter des fonctionnalit√©s manquantes comme les media-queries, pseudo-s√©lecteurs, etc.
translations.en: Biblioth√®que CSS avec bindings React, proposant un v√©ritable retour aux bases via les styles inline. Dans [Du chaos CSS aux CSS Hooks](https://nsaunders.dev/posts/css-madness-to-hooks), l'auteur explique comment il utilise une astuce CSS variable pour supporter les fonctionnalit√©s manquantes comme les media-queries, pseudo-s√©lecteurs etc.

segments.source_content: Personally, I've always preferred the DX of inline styles, but in practice this is too limited and doesn't always perform well. It remains to be seen whether this innovation will hold up in practice. Mark Dalgleish (üê¶ [tweet](https://twitter.com/markdalgleish/status/1729399475494608923)) is excited about it. Note Adam Wathan probably wouldn't have created Tailwind if inline styles had better support (üê¶ [tweet](https://twitter.com/adamwathan/status/1732209400641724785)).

translations.fr: Personnellement, j'ai toujours pr√©f√©r√© l'exp√©rience d√©veloppeur des styles inline, mais en pratique c'est trop limit√© et pas toujours performant. Reste √† voir si cette innovation tiendra en pratique. Mark Dalgleish (üê¶ [tweet](https://twitter.com/markdalgleish/status/1729399475494608923)) est enthousiaste. Notez qu'Adam Wathan n'aurait probablement pas cr√©√© Tailwind si les styles inline avaient un meilleur support (üê¶ [tweet](https://twitter.com/adamwathan/status/1732209400641724785)).
translations.en: Personnellement, j'ai toujours pr√©f√©r√© la DX des styles inline, mais en pratique c'est trop limit√© et pas toujours performant. Reste √† voir si cette innovation tiendra. Mark Dalgleish (üê¶ [tweet](https://twitter.com/markdalgleish/status/1729399475494608923)) s'en r√©jouit. Notez qu'Adam Wathan n'aurait probablement pas cr√©√© Tailwind si les styles inline avaient un meilleur support (üê¶ [tweet](https://twitter.com/adamwathan/status/1732209400641724785)).

segments.source_content:
- üí∏ [Developer Nation Survey - What's next for developers in 2024 and beyond? Take the survey and win prizes!](https://developereconomics.net/?member_id=thisweekinreact&utm_medium=nl_ad1)
- üëÄ [Remix RFC - Client Data (clientLoader, clientAction)](https://github.com/remix-run/remix/discussions/7634): new exports should soon be supported by Remix, making it easier for those who wish to migrate React-Router apps to Remix
- üê¶ [Using TanStack React Query v5 + Router preview](https://twitter.com/tannerlinsley/status/1730621837212876829)
- üìú [How does xxx compare to Panda CSS](https://www.astahmer.dev/posts/how-does-xxx-compares-to-panda-css): good presentation of Panda CSS by its maintainer, who also outlines its current limitations. A modern CSS-in-JS solution based on static analysis and compatible with Server Components. There is a light JS runtime, but the atomic CSS remains extracted at build time.
- üìú [Tailwind has a scalability problem. How can we solve that?](https://byteofdev.com/posts/scale-tailwindcss/): suggests using `cva` (Class Variance Authority) to make Tailwind code more digestible in a React context.
- üìú [Guide to fast websites with Next.js: Tips for maximizing server speeds and minimizing client burden](https://vercel.com/blog/guide-to-fast-websites-with-next-js-tips-for-maximizing-server-speeds): guest post on an agency's Vercel blog explaining the Next.js techniques used to achieve very good performance.
- üìú [Fastest Way of Passing State to JavaScript, Re-visited](https://calendar.perfplanet.com/2023/fastest-way-passing-state-javascript-revisited/): SSR-based React/Redux apps need to send the store data to the client-side for hydration. Presents 3 techniques with their performance.
- üìú [Keep Your Loader Data Fresh in Remix](https://sergiodxa.com/tutorials/keep-your-loader-data-fresh-in-remix): shows how to call the `useRevalidator` hook when the connection is restored or the tab regains focus.
- üìú [Build your own StorybookGPT](https://storybook.js.org/blog/build-your-own-storybook-gpt/): explains how to use AI to generate your stories automatically.
- üìú [Introducing React components for the Maps JavaScript API](https://cloud.google.com/blog/products/maps-platform/introducing-react-components-for-the-maps-javascript-api/): Google is finally officially sponsoring the development of a React lib for Google Maps.
- üìú [Slack - Building Custom Animations in the Workflow Builder](https://slack.engineering/building-custom-animations-in-the-workflow-builder/): feedback from Slack on the implementation of drag-and-drop features with `react-beautiful-dnd `.
- üìú [How Relay Enables Optimal Data Fetching](https://relay.dev/blog/2023/10/24/how-relay-enables-optimal-data-fetching/)
- üìú [TanStack Router ‚Äì modern React for the rest of us](https://swizec.com/blog/tanstack-router-modern-react-for-the-rest-of-us/)
- üìú [Handling HTML within React i18next translations](https://rafaelcamargo.com/blog/handling-html-within-react-i18next-translations/)
- üìú [A minimal dependency-free translation system for Next.js](https://www.thomasledoux.be/blog/minimal-dependency-free-translation-system-nextjs)
- üìú [An Introduction To Full Stack Composability](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2023/11/introduction-full-stack-composability/)
- üì¶ [Redux Toolkit 2.0, Redux 5.0, React-Redux 9.0, Reselect 5.0, Redux-Thunk 3.0](https://github.com/reduxjs/redux-toolkit/releases/tag/v2.0.0): big synchronised update of all Redux packages. Includes new features (`combineSlices`), improvements in size, performance, typing, and removal of deprecated features.
- üì¶ [Astro 4.0 - Dev Toolbar, i18n routing, Incremental Content Caching, View Transition APIs...](https://astro.build/blog/astro-4/)
- üì¶ [Storybook 7.6 - switch to SWC, faster, react-docgen upgrade, controls improvement, doctor CLI...](https://storybook.js.org/blog/storybook-7-6/)
- üì¶ [Remix Dev Tools 3.5 - Vite support](https://github.com/Code-Forge-Net/Remix-Dev-Tools/releases/tag/v3.5.0)
- üì¶ [Starlight 0.14 - Plugin API](https://github.com/withastro/starlight/releases/tag/%40astrojs%2Fstarlight%400.14.0)
- üì¶ [Jotai 2.6 - use `<Provider>` in React Server Components](https://github.com/pmndrs/jotai/releases/tag/v2.6.0)

- üé• [Lee Robinson - Introduction to Next.js and React](https://www.youtube.com/@leerob)

segments.source_content: [Wallaby.js](https://wallabyjs.com/?referrer=ThisWeekInReact1) runs your tests immediately as you type, with runtime values, errors, and code coverage displayed in real-time right next to your code.

translations.fr: [Wallaby.js](https://wallabyjs.com/?referrer=ThisWeekInReact1) ex√©cute vos tests imm√©diatement pendant que vous tapez, avec les valeurs d'ex√©cution, les erreurs et la couverture de code affich√©es en temps r√©el √† c√¥t√© de votre code.

segments.source_content: Designed specifically for testing, Wallaby features include a [Time Travel Debugger](https://wallabyjs.com/docs/intro/time-travel-debugger.html?referrer=ThisWeekInReact1), the ability to only run opened test files, and more.

translations.fr: Con√ßu sp√©cifiquement pour les tests, Wallaby propose notamment un [d√©bogueur √† voyage temporel](https://wallabyjs.com/docs/intro/time-travel-debugger.html?referrer=ThisWeekInReact1), la possibilit√© de n'ex√©cuter que les fichiers de test ouverts, et plus encore.
